snippet: At the Venice Film Festival, the divisive film "Pieta," which one Catholic organization considers blasphemous, won the top prize, while the lead actors and director of "The Master" also took home awards.
abstract: At the Venice Film Festival, the divisive film "Pieta," which one Catholic organization considers blasphemous, won the top prize, while the lead actors and director of "The Master" also took home awards.

headline.main: Venice Film Festival: 'Pieta' and 'The Master' Come Up Winners
